page.title: 08WITLEY COURT CHARITY BALL
page.content: Partygoers from around the world flew into the county for a Â£27-a-head costume charity ball at Great Witley Court on July 6th 1985. Three hundred jetsetters from United States, France, Belgium and Germany danced the night away under marquees in the grounds of the ruined stately home.The ball was held to raise money for the restoration of Great Witley's unique baroque chapel.Guests, who looked as though they were straight from Gainsborough portraits or the ballrooms of Versailles, dressed in vast powdered wigs and flowing dresses.They drank champagne by the great fountain in front of the house and danced until the dawn peered through the ruined windows of the stately mansion. {With acknowledgments to Berrows {Newspapers Ltd. Worcester.}
